<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Columns&nbsp;(b) through&nbsp;(f) present information about stock options awarded to each named executive officer under the Incentive Plan. Each option
award vests in increments of 25% on each of the first four anniversaries of the grant date, subject to earlier vesting in the event of a change in control for awards granted prior to April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011. Awards granted on or after
April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, will vest earlier if a qualifying replacement award is not outstanding after the change in control. Generally, upon termination of employment, vested options must be exercised and unvested options are cancelled, except in
the case of retirement, death or disability in which case the options (i)&nbsp;continue to vest as scheduled (in the case of awards granted prior to April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011) or (ii)&nbsp;vest immediately (in the case of awards granted on or after
April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011). Participants whose </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">66 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">
employment terminates due to retirement, death or disability may exercise vested options for up to three or five years (based on the terms and conditions of the grant) after termination of
employment. Options granted in the year of retirement are prorated based upon the number of full calendar months worked in that year. If termination occurs within two years after a change in control for any reason other than for Cause or by the
executive without Good Reason, any replacement awards relating to options granted on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, will vest in full and may be exercised for one year after termination. If an executive officer is under age&nbsp;55 (and for
options granted on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, has completed less than five years of service), and his or her employment is terminated for reasons other than for Cause or by the executive without Good Reason, the executive will be eligible to
exercise all vested stock options and a prorated portion of his or her unvested stock options held on the date of separation from service for a period of 120 days following separation. No option may be exercised after its expiration date.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Options listed in Column&nbsp;(b) are vested and may be exercised by the executive at any time subject to the terms of the stock option. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Options listed in Column&nbsp;(c) were not vested as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. The following table provides information with respect to the dates on which these
options are scheduled to vest, subject to continued employment (or retirement, death or disability), prorating in the event of severance, and possible acceleration in the event of a change in control. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

the Committee, or, in the case of Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey, determined by the independent members of our Board. The results of the 2010-2012 performance cycle that ended on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, exceeded the financial targets established at the start
of the performance cycle. The awards included in Column&nbsp;(d) reflect payment at 226.49% of target. Ms.&nbsp;Buck elected to defer payment of her award as described below. Messrs.&nbsp;Bilbrey, Alfonso, and&nbsp;O&#146;Day received payment in
Common Stock for their award in February&nbsp;2013. In accordance with the terms of the PSU award, each PSU represents one share of our Common Stock valued in Column&nbsp;(e) at $72.22, the closing price of our Common Stock on the New York Stock

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">On February&nbsp;17,&nbsp;2012, 625&nbsp;RSUs awarded to Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey in 2009 vested. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey elected to defer 100% of this award. On the vesting date of
these RSUs, Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey received a cash payment of $2,406, which was equivalent to dividends that would have been earned had he held Common Stock instead of RSUs during the vesting period. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey utilized the net cash received after
taxes to meet tax obligations on the deferred portion of his award, resulting in deferral of all 625&nbsp;shares. Based on Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s deferral election, these 625&nbsp;RSUs will be paid as shares of Common Stock, net of applicable
taxes, upon his separation from service from the Company, subject to the requirements of section 409A of the IRC. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Company&#146;s Common Stock. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey received cash payments of $19,519, which were equivalent to dividends that would have been earned had he held Common Stock instead of RSUs during the vesting period. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey
liquidated 1,545&nbsp;RSUs to meet tax obligations, resulting in his receipt of 2,205&nbsp;shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">68 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc465857_21"></A>Pension Benefits </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each of the named executive officers, with the exception of Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day and Ms.&nbsp;Turner, is a participant in our tax-qualified defined
benefit pension plan and is fully vested in his or her benefit under that plan. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey and Ms.&nbsp;Buck are eligible to participate in our non-qualified DB&nbsp;SERP. No benefit is payable under the DB&nbsp;SERP if the executive officer
terminates employment prior to age 55 or if he or she does not have five years of service with the Company. As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey had attained age 55 with five years of service. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The combination of the tax-qualified and DB&nbsp;SERP plans were designed to provide a benefit upon retirement at or after reaching age 60 based on a
joint and survivor annuity equal to 55% of final average compensation for an executive officer with 15 or more years of service (reduced pro rata for each year of service under 15). Effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, the benefit payable under the
DB&nbsp;SERP to an executive officer who was age 50 or over as of January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, was reduced by 10%, and the benefit payable to an executive officer who had not attained age 50 as of January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, was reduced by 20%. The
benefit payable to Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey was reduced by 10% and the benefit payable to Ms.&nbsp;Buck was reduced by 20%. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Final average
compensation is calculated as the sum of (i)&nbsp;the average of the highest three calendar years of base salary paid over the last five years of employment with the Company and (ii)&nbsp;the average of the highest three annual incentive program
awards for the last five years of employment with the Company, whether paid or deferred. The benefit accrued under the DB&nbsp;SERP is payable upon retirement as a lump sum, a life annuity with 50% benefit continuation to the participant&#146;s
surviving spouse, or payment may be deferred in accordance with the provisions of the Company&#146;s Deferred Compensation Plan. The lump sum is equal to the actuarial present value of the joint and survivor pension earned, reduced by the lump sum
value of the benefits to be paid under the tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan and the value of the executive&#146;s Social Security benefits. If the executive officer terminates employment after age 55 but before age 60, the benefit is
reduced for early retirement at a rate of 5%&nbsp;per year for the period until the executive would have turned 60. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The CLRP provides
eligible participants the defined benefit he or she would have earned under our tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan were it not for the legal limitation on compensation used to determine benefits. An executive officer who is a participant in
the DB&nbsp;SERP is not eligible to participate in the CLRP, unless he or she (i)&nbsp;ceases to be designated by the Committee as eligible to participate in the DB&nbsp;SERP prior to his or her termination of employment with the Company or
(ii)&nbsp;has his or her employment involuntarily terminated by the Company other than for Cause prior to vesting in the DB&nbsp;SERP. Executive officers meeting these criteria become eligible to participate in the CLRP and receive a benefit for all
years in which they would have been a participant of the CLRP had they not been designated by the Committee to be eligible for the DB&nbsp;SERP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Executive officers who are eligible for both the DC&nbsp;SERP (described under Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation below) and the tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan receive an additional credit
under the CLRP equal to 3% of eligible earnings less the IRS annual limitation on compensation. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso is the only named executive officer eligible for the CLRP. Upon separation, benefits under the CLRP are payable in a single lump sum or
may be deferred into the Deferred Compensation Plan. A participant is eligible for his or her CLRP benefit upon separation from service (subject to the provisions of section 409A of the IRC) after five years of service or attaining age 55 (unless
the participant is terminated for Cause). Payment is also made to the estate of a participant who dies prior to separation from service. Participants who become disabled are 100% vested in their benefit and continue to accrue additional benefits for
up to two additional years. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">69 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table and explanatory footnotes provide information regarding the present value of benefits
accrued under the tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan, as applicable, and the DB&nbsp;SERP or CLRP for each named executive officer as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. The amounts shown for the DB&nbsp;SERP reflect the reduction for the
present value of the benefits under the tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan and Social Security benefits. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Pension
Benefits </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2012 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">T. L. O&#146;Day</FONT></P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&#151;</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">L. M.
Turner</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&#151;</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px" BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc465857_22"></A>Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our named executive officers are eligible to participate in The Hershey Company Deferred Compensation Plan. The Deferred Compensation Plan is a
non-qualified, non-funded plan that permits participants to defer compensation that would otherwise be paid to them currently. The Deferred Compensation Plan is intended to secure the goodwill and loyalty of participants by enabling them to defer
compensation when the participants deem it beneficial to do so and by providing a vehicle for the Company to provide, on a non-qualified basis, contributions that could </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">70 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
not be made on the participants&#146; behalf to the tax-qualified 401(k). The Company credits the Deferred Compensation Plan with a specified percentage of compensation for executive officers
participating in the non-qualified DC&nbsp;SERP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our named executive officers may elect to defer payments to be received from the
DB&nbsp;SERP, DC&nbsp;SERP, CLRP, and the OHIP as well as PSU and RSU awards, but not stock options. Amounts deferred are fully vested and are credited to the individual&#146;s account under the Deferred Compensation Plan. Participants elect to
receive payment at termination of employment or some other future date. DB&nbsp;SERP and CLRP payments designated for deferral into the Deferred Compensation Plan are not credited as earned but are credited in full upon the participant&#146;s
retirement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payments are distributed in a lump sum or in annual installments for up to 15 years. All amounts are payable in a lump sum
following a change in control. All elections and payments under the Deferred Compensation Plan are subject to compliance with section 409A of the IRC which may limit elections and require a delay in payment of benefits in certain circumstances.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">While deferred, amounts are credited with notional earnings as if they were invested by the participant in one or more investment options
offered by the Deferred Compensation Plan. The investment options under the Deferred Compensation Plan consist of investment in a deferred common stock unit account that we value according to the performance of our Common Stock (for awards paid in
stock) or in mutual funds or other investments available to participants in our 401(k) (for awards paid in cash). The participants&#146; accounts under the Deferred Compensation Plan are adjusted daily, up or down, depending upon performance of the
investment options elected. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, we began crediting the deferred compensation accounts of all employees,
including the named executive officers, with the amount of employer matching contributions that exceed the limits established by the IRS for contribution to the 401(k). These amounts are credited in the first quarter of the year after they are
earned. As shown in the footnotes to the Summary Compensation Table beginning on page&nbsp;60, these amounts are designated as &#147;Supplemental 401(k) match&#148; and are included as &#147;All Other Compensation&#148; in the year earned. These
amounts also are included in Column&nbsp;(c) of the Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation table in the year earned. All of the named executive officers are fully vested in the Supplemental 401(k) match credits presented and will be paid at a future
date or at termination of employment, as elected by the officer. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, we began crediting the deferred
compensation accounts of all employees hired on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, including eligible named executive officers, with the amount of core retirement contributions that exceed the limits established by the IRS for contribution to the
401(k). These amounts are credited in the first quarter of the year after they are earned. As shown in the footnotes to the Summary Compensation Table, these amounts are designated as &#147;Supplemental Core Retirement Contribution&#148; and are
included as &#147;All Other Compensation&#148; in the year earned. These amounts also are included in Column&nbsp;(c) of the Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation table in the year earned. Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day was the only named executive officer
eligible for a Supplemental Core Retirement Contribution credit for 2012. He is fully vested in this benefit and will receive payment for this benefit at termination of employment subject to the provisions of section 409A of the IRC. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso, Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day and Ms.&nbsp;Turner are eligible to participate in our DC&nbsp;SERP, a part of the Deferred Compensation Plan. The
DC&nbsp;SERP provides annual allocations to the Deferred Compensation Plan equal to a percentage of compensation determined by the Committee in its sole discretion. In order to receive the annual DC&nbsp;SERP allocation, an executive officer must
(i)&nbsp;defer in the 401(k) the maximum amount allowed by the Company or IRS and (ii)&nbsp;be employed </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">71 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
on the last day of the plan year unless he or she terminates employment while at least age 55, retires, dies or becomes disabled. After completing five years of service with the Company, an
executive officer is vested in 10% increments based on his or her age. An executive age&nbsp;46 with five years of service is 10% vested and an executive age 55 with five years of service is 100% vested. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso&#146;s,
Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day&#146;s and Ms.&nbsp;Turner&#146;s annual DC&nbsp;SERP allocation is equal to 12.5% of base salary and OHIP award for the calendar year, whether paid or deferred. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso is 100% vested in his DC&nbsp;SERP benefit.
Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day and Ms.&nbsp;Turner are not vested in any portion of their DC&nbsp;SERP benefit. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table and explanatory
footnotes provide information relating to the activity in the Deferred Compensation Plan accounts of the named executive officers during 2012 and the aggregate balance of the accounts as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2012 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Column&nbsp;(b) reflects amounts that otherwise would have been received by Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey, Ms.&nbsp;Buck and Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day during 2012 as payment of PSU and
RSU awards but were deferred under the Deferred Compensation Plan. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey deferred both PSU and RSU awards. Ms.&nbsp;Buck and Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day deferred their PSU award. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

were deducted from Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s 2009-2011 PSU award that vested December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2011. The value of these awards is not listed in the Summary Compensation Table of this proxy statement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&#151;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc465857_23"></A>Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We maintain plans covering our executive officers that will require us to provide incremental compensation in the event of involuntary termination of
employment or a change in control. We describe these obligations below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Overview </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;7,&nbsp;2012, the independent members of our Board of Directors, based on a recommendation from the Committee, authorized our entering
into an employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey, our President and CEO. The employment agreement provides for Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s continued employment as President and CEO and as a member of the Board of Directors. The employment agreement
does not have a specified term; Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s employment is on an at-will basis. In the event Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s employment is terminated by the Company without Cause or he resigns for Good Reason (in each case as defined in the
employment agreement), Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey will be entitled to certain severance benefits. In the event of his termination after a change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey will be eligible to receive benefits under the EBPP 3A. He is not entitled to an
excise tax gross-up. The employment agreement subjects Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey to certain non-competition and non-solicitation covenants under the ECRCA (as described below) and to compensation recovery (clawback) to the extent required by applicable law
and regulations. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our other named executive officers also participate in the EBPP&nbsp;3A. The EBPP&nbsp;3A is intended to help us attract and
retain qualified executive employees and maintain a stable work environment by making a provision for the protection of covered executives in connection with a change in control of Hershey or termination of employment under certain circumstances.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each of our named executive officers was required to sign an Executive Confidentiality and Restrictive Covenant Agreement, or ECRCA, as a
condition to receiving long-term incentive compensation awards such as stock options and PSUs. The ECRCA obligates the executive officer to not disclose or misuse our confidential and proprietary information or, for a period of 12 months following
termination, carry on any activities that compete with our business. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">73 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Termination of employment and a change in control also impact PSUs, RSUs and stock option awards we have
made, as well as benefits payable under our employee benefit plans. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following narrative takes each termination of employment situation
&#150; voluntary resignation, discharge for Cause, death, disability, retirement, discharge without Cause, and resignation for Good Reason &#150; and a change in control of the Company, and describes the additional amounts, if any, that the Company
would pay or provide to Messrs.&nbsp;Bilbrey, Alfonso, and O&#146;Day,&nbsp;Ms.&nbsp;Buck and Ms.&nbsp;Turner, or their beneficiaries as a result. The narrative below and the amounts shown reflect certain assumptions we have made in accordance with
SEC rules. We have assumed that the termination of employment or change in control occurred on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012 and that the value of a share of our Common Stock on that day was $72.22, the closing price on the New York Stock Exchange on
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, in keeping with SEC rules, the following narrative and amounts do not include payments and benefits
which are not enhanced by the termination of employment or change in control. These payments and benefits include: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Benefits accrued under the Company&#146;s broad-based, tax-qualified 401(k) and tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Accrued vacation pay, health plan continuation and other similar amounts payable when employment terminates under programs generally applicable to the
Company&#146;s salaried employees; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Supplemental 401(k) match provided to the named executive officers on the same basis as all other employees eligible for Supplemental 401(k) match;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Vested benefits accrued under the DB&nbsp;SERP and account balances held under the Deferred Compensation Plan as described above beginning on
pages&nbsp;69 and 70; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Stock options which have vested and become exercisable prior to termination of employment or change in control. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The payments and benefits described in the five bullet points above are referred to in the following discussion as the executive officer&#146;s
&#147;vested benefits.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Voluntary Resignation </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We are not obligated to pay amounts over and above vested benefits to a named executive officer who voluntarily resigns. Vested stock options may not be exercised after the named executive officer&#146;s
resignation date unless the officer is age 55 or older and, in certain instances, has met minimum service requirements as described in Treatment of Stock Options upon Retirement, Death or Disability below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Discharge for Cause </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If we terminate a
named executive officer&#146;s employment for Cause, we are not obligated to pay the officer any amounts over and above the vested benefits. The named executive officer&#146;s right to exercise vested options expires upon discharge for Cause, and
amounts otherwise payable under the DB&nbsp;SERP are subject to forfeiture at the Company&#146;s discretion. In general, a discharge will be for Cause if the executive has intentionally failed to perform his or her duties or engaged in illegal or
gross misconduct that harms the Company. Effective in February&nbsp;2011, the EBPP&nbsp;3A was amended to provide that engaging in illegal conduct, gross negligence or willful misconduct, material dishonesty or violation of Company policies, or bad
faith actions not in the best interests of the Company will be grounds for discharge for Cause. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">74 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Death or Disability </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If an executive officer dies and has not met the vesting requirements to be eligible to receive a benefit from the DB&nbsp;SERP, no benefits are paid. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey is fully vested in his DB&nbsp;SERP
benefits as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A maximum monthly long-term disability benefit of $35,000 would be provided for Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey
and $25,000 for all other named executive officers in the event of long-term disability. Long-term disability benefits are payable until age 65. Long-term disability benefits are offset by other benefits such as Social Security. The maximum amount
of the monthly long-term disability payments from all sources, assuming long-term disability on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, is set forth in the tables below. The additional lump sum DB&nbsp;SERP amount that would be payable for Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey and
Ms.&nbsp;Buck at age 65, attributable to vesting and benefit service credited during the disability period for the DB&nbsp;SERP, if the executive&#146;s disability started on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, is shown on the table below. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso
participates in the CLRP which provides two additional years of credit after approval for long-term disability benefits. Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day and Ms.&nbsp;Turner are eligible for the Supplemental Core Retirement Contribution and would receive up to
two additional years of Supplemental Core Retirement Contribution credit after approval for long-term disability benefits payable up to age 65. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso, Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day and Ms.&nbsp;Turner participate in the DC&nbsp;SERP which provides
up to two additional years of credit after approval for long-term disability benefits payable up to age 65. Those amounts are listed in the table below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Reflects two additional years of Supplemental Core Retirement Contribution and DC SERP credit and full vesting upon disability. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Treatment of Stock Options upon Retirement, Death or Disability </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event of retirement, death or disability, vested stock options remain exercisable for a period of three or five years but not later than the option expiration date. The exercise period is based
upon the terms and conditions of the individual grant. For awards granted prior to April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, retirement was defined as separation after attainment of age 55. For awards granted on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, retirement is
defined as separation after attainment of age 55 with at least five years of service. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">75 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Options awarded prior to April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, that are not vested at the time of retirement, death or
disability will continue to vest over the five years following termination in accordance with the original vesting schedule established on the grant date. Options granted on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, that are not vested at the time of
retirement, death or disability will vest in full and the options will remain exercisable for three or five years following termination. Options granted in the year of retirement are prorated based upon the number of full calendar months worked in
that year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table provides the number of unvested stock options as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, that would have become vested
and remained exercisable during the three-year or five-year periods following death or disability, or retirement, if applicable, on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, and the value of those options based on the excess of the fair market value of our
Common Stock on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, over the option exercise price. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey and Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso were considered retirement eligible based on the provisions of all option awards on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="60%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="6" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Stock Options</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" NOWRAP ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Number<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(#)</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Treatment of RSUs upon Retirement, Death or Disability </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Upon retirement any RSUs held by our named executive officers that are not vested are forfeited. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A prorated portion of unvested RSUs granted prior to April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, will vest upon death or disability. The prorated number of RSUs is based
upon the number of full and partial calendar months from the grant date to the date of death or disability divided by the full and partial calendar months from the grant date to the end of the restriction period, multiplied by the number of RSUs
originally granted. Unvested RSUs granted on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, will vest in full upon death or disability. The following table summarizes the unvested RSU awards that would have vested on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, if the
executive&#146;s employment terminated that day due to death or disability. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="60%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Value of shares based on $72.22, the closing price for our Common Stock on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Discharge Not for Cause; Resignation for Good Reason </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s employment agreement and the EBPP&nbsp;3A, as applicable, we have agreed to pay severance benefits of two times base salary in a lump sum if we terminate the executive
officer&#146;s active employment without Cause (one and one-half times base salary if the executive became a participant in EBPP&nbsp;3A after February&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2011). We have agreed to provide to Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey as additional severance
payments an amount equal to two times his target award under the OHIP, and to other named executive officers, additional severance payments in the amount that the executive officer would have been eligible to receive under the OHIP for a period of
two years (18 months for participants first covered by EBPP&nbsp;3A after February&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2011) following termination. Under Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s employment agreement and EBPP 3A, the executive would be entitled to receive a pro rata
payment of the OHIP award, if any, earned for the year in which termination occurs. These benefits also are payable if the executive officer resigns from active employment for Good Reason. Good Reason will arise under Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s
employment agreement in the event of a diminution of his title, duties, responsibilities, a material breach of the employment agreement by the Company, any adverse amendment to the DB&nbsp;SERP or EBPP 3A affecting Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey or his removal or
failure to be reelected to the Board. Good Reason arises under the EBPP&nbsp;3A if we appoint a new Chief Executive Officer, and during the first two years of his or her tenure, the executive officer&#146;s position, authority, duties or
responsibilities are diminished or base salary is reduced. If Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s or an executive officer&#146;s employment is terminated for reasons other than for Cause or if the executive officer terminates for Good Reason, the Company will
continue the executive&#146;s welfare benefits for a period of two years. For executives first covered by EBPP 3A after February&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2011, welfare benefit coverage will </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">77 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
continue for 18 months. Ms.&nbsp;Turner is the only named executive officer first covered by EBPP 3A after February&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2011. Coverage for disability and participation in all
tax-qualified retirement plans will not be continued. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If an executive officer is under age 55 and his or her employment is terminated for
reasons other than for Cause, or if the executive officer terminates for Good Reason, the executive will be eligible to exercise all vested stock options and a prorated portion of his or her unvested stock options held on the date of separation from
service for a period of 120 days following separation. If the executive officer is age 55 or older (with five or more years of service with respect to stock options granted on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011) and his or her employment is
terminated for reasons other than for Cause, or if the executive terminates for Good Reason, the executive will be entitled to exercise (provided any vesting requirement has been satisfied as of the date of exercise) any outstanding stock options
until the earlier of three or five years (based on the provisions of the individual grant) from the date of termination or the expiration of the options. In addition, if an executive officer&#146;s employment is terminated for reasons other than for
Cause, or if the executive officer terminates for Good Reason, the executive will receive payment for a prorated portion of any unvested RSUs held on the date of separation from service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table summarizes the incremental amounts that would have been payable to the named executive officer had his or her employment terminated on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, under circumstances
entitling the officer to severance benefits as described above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Awards table. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Special provisions apply if a change in control occurs. In general, a change in control will occur if the Milton Hershey School Trust no longer owns voting control of the Company and another person or
group acquires 30% or more of the combined voting power of our voting stock; there is an unwelcome change in a majority of the members of our Board; or, if after consummation of a merger or similar business transaction or a sale of substantially all
of our assets, the Milton Hershey School Trust does not own voting control of the merged or acquiring company. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">78 </FONT></P>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The EBPP&nbsp;3A provides the vesting and payment of the following benefits upon a change in control to
each of the named executive officers: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">An OHIP payment for the year of the change in control at the greater of target or the estimated payment based on actual performance to the date of the
change in control; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For awards granted prior to April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, full vesting for any PSU awards for the performance cycle ending in the year of the change in
control. The cash payment will be based upon the greater of target or actual performance through the date of the change in control, with each PSU valued at the highest closing price for our Common Stock during the 60 days prior to the change in
control; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Incentive Plan provides for full vesting of all outstanding stock options and RSUs (including accrued cash credits equivalent to dividends that would
have been earned had the executive held Common Stock instead of RSUs) granted prior to April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, upon a change in control. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The vesting and payment provisions applicable to PSUs, stock options and RSUs described above in the event of a change in control will not automatically
apply to awards made on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011. Under our Incentive Plan, if such awards are continued as a qualifying replacement award after the change in control, then no accelerated vesting or payment will occur because of the change
in control. In the event of termination of employment within two years following the change in control for any reason other than termination for Cause or resignation without Good Reason, the replacement award will vest and become payable as
described above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table and explanatory footnotes provide information with respect to the incremental amounts that would have
vested and become payable on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, if a change in control occurred on that date and any awards made on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, were continued as qualifying replacement awards. </FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>PSU</B></FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

difference between a value per PSU of $74.64, the highest closing price for our Common Stock during the last 60 days of 2012, and a value per PSU of $72.22, the closing price of our Common Stock on the New York Stock Exchange on
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, over the exercise price for the options. Information regarding unvested options as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, can be found in the Outstanding Equity Awards table. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Reflects the value of unvested RSUs and the accrued cash credits that would vest upon a change in control based on the market value of our Common Stock of $72.22 on
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. The accrued cash credits are equivalent to dividends that would have been earned had the executive held Common Stock instead of RSUs. Information regarding unvested RSUs as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, can be found in
the Outstanding Equity Awards table. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Totals reflect full vesting of DB&nbsp;SERP and more favorable early retirement discount factors as provided under the EBPP&nbsp;3A. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey is fully vested in
his DB&nbsp;SERP benefit so no additional benefit is applicable. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso is fully vested in his DC&nbsp;SERP benefit so no additional benefit is applicable. For Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day, the amount includes the vesting of his DC&nbsp;SERP
benefit. For Ms.&nbsp;Buck, the amount includes the vesting of her DB&nbsp;SERP benefit. For Ms.&nbsp;Turner, the amount includes the vesting of her DC&nbsp;SERP and other non-vested retirement benefits. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">For any given executive, the total payments made in the event of termination after a change in control would be reduced to the &#147;safe harbor&#148; limit under IRC
section 280G if such reduction would result in a greater after-tax benefit for the executive. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Discharge Not for Cause or
Resignation for Good Reason after Change in Control </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the named executive officer&#146;s employment is terminated by the Company without
Cause or by the executive for Good Reason within two years after a change in control, we pay severance benefits to assist the executive in transitioning to new employment. Good Reason for this purpose means diminution of the executive&#146;s
position, authority, duties or responsibilities; a reduction in base salary; failure to pay current compensation or to continue in effect short- and long-term compensation and employee and retirement benefits; or the failure to fund a grantor trust
to support payment of amounts under the EBPP&nbsp;3A. The severance benefits under the EBPP&nbsp;3A for termination after a change in control as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, consist of: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A lump sum cash payment equal to two (or, if less, the number of full and fractional years from the date of termination to the executive&#146;s
65</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> birthday, but not less than one) times:
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the executive&#146;s base salary; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the highest annual incentive program payment paid or payable during the three years preceding the year of the change in control (but not less than the
annual incentive program target for the year of the change in control); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For replacement awards relating to awards granted on or after April&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, full vesting for any PSU awards for the performance cycle
ending in the year of the change in control. The cash payment will be based upon the greater of target or actual performance through the date of the change in control, with each PSU valued at the highest closing price for our Common Stock during the
60 days prior to the change in control; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

the second year of the performance cycle at the time of the change in control and prorated vesting of outstanding PSU awards at target that are in the first year of the performance cycle at the time of the change in control;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

months), or payment of the value of such benefits if continuation is not permitted under the terms of the applicable plan; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
